Translate this Dakota sentence to English:

Mdewakantọnwans
answer: Village of the Spirit Lake. Their name is derived from a former residence at Mdewakan (Spirit or Sacred Lake), Mille Lacs. They are divided into seven principal villages, three of which are still on the western bank of the Mississippi, and the others on or near the Minnesota, within twenty-five or thirty miles of Fort Snelling. Their number, as now enrolled, is about two thousand.

prompt:
Translate this Dakota sentence to English:

Wahpetọnwans
answer: Village in the Leaves, probably obtained their name from the fact that formerly they lived only in the woods. The old home of this band is about the Little Rapids, which is some forty-five miles by water from the mouth of the Minnesota river. About three hundred still reside there; but the larger part of the band have removed to Lac-qui-parle and Big Stone Lake. In all, they number about one thousand or twelve hundred souls.

Ateuŋyaŋpi mahpiya ekta naŋke ćiŋ; Nićaźo kiŋ wakaŋdapi kte; Nitokićoŋze kiŋ u kte. Mahpiya ekta token nitawaćiŋ ećoŋpi kiŋ, maka akaŋ hećen ećoŋpi nuywe. Aŋpetu kiŋ de taku-yutapi uŋku-po; ka wauŋhtanipi kiŋ uŋkićićaźuźu-po, uŋkiś iyećen tona ećiŋśniyan uŋkokićihanyaŋpi hena iyećen wićuŋkićićaźuźupi kiŋ. Wowawiyutaŋye kiŋ he en iyaye uŋyaŋpi śni-po, ka taku śića etaŋhaŋ euŋhdaku-po. Wokićoŋze kiŋ, wowaś'ake kiŋ, wowitan kiŋ, henakiya owihaŋke wanin nitawa nuywe. Amen.

Gloss: Father-we-have heaven in thou-art the; Thy-name the holy-regarded shall; Thy-kingdom the come shall. Heaven in how thy-will is-done the, earth upon so done may-it-be. Day the this food us-give; and our-trespasses the erase-for-us, we like-as as-may-as wrongly have-done-to-us those even-as them-we-forgive the. Temptation the that into to-go us-cause not, and what bad from us-deliver. Kingdom the, strength the, glory the, all-these end none thine may-be. Amen.
answer: Our Father who art in heaven; Hallowed be thy name; Thy kingdom come. Thy will be done in earth, as it is in heaven. Give us this day our daily bread. And forgive us our trespasses, as we forgive those who trespass against us. And lead us not into temptation, but deliver us from evil. For thine is the kingdom, and the power, and the glory, for ever. Amen.
